main event: A cylindrical silver object was observed in Worthington, Ohio, on July 30, 1948, moving very slowly at an altitude of approximately 3000 feet.
interesting points: The object was observed for 15 minutes and emitted a steady silver glow.,Witnesses reported no sound emitted by the object.,There were no standard aircraft lights displayed on the object.,The sky was clear with high scattered clouds during the observation.,The sighting was made by a civilian and his wife.
witness description: A male civilian and his wife.
